Tom Cruise is a famous actor. He has been in many movies. As a young boy, Tom was shy and had trouble making friends. After he finished school, Tom went to New York to find a job. He found a job as a porter and took acting classes. In 1980, Tom got his first part in a movie. Later, he became very successful and earned a lot of money. Today, Tom still acts in movies and is popular with his fans.

Little cat, little cat, where have you been? Bo the cat decided to explore a furniture van one day. She was discovered by the driver after he finished his trip. It was a long day. The driver and the cat were both hungry. He gave her some milk and started making enquiries. He called his last customers, but they had not lost a cat. It was getting late, so he took Bo home for the night. The next morning, he delivered Bo to an animal hospital. The cat's owner had done some detective work too. After searching everywhere for the cat, he remembered the furniture van which had made a delivery to a neighbour. Fortunately, he remembered the name of the company. He called their office and in a short time Bo was returned safely.

The Ghan Train Mark Ottaway travelled by train from Darwin to Adelaide in Australia. The Ghan train crosses the Australian continent. It is often called the 'famous Ghan', which is perhaps unfortunate since it is known, above all, for being late. The railway was originally built to carry goods. It was thought that sending goods from Europe to Australia's densely populated south via Darwin and the train, rather than around the continent by ship, would save time and money. From Alice Springs there are two trains a week heading south. My journey was over and, although the train might not have delivered on everything the advertisements promise, it had taken me to several of the most amazing sights that Australia has to offer.

Climbing to the top of Britain each year thousands of people climb Ben Nevis in Scotland. The weather can be very cold. Climber Keith Hewitt describes his first time on Ben Nevis. It was his first big winter climb. The route was up the north face of the mountain to Tower Ridge. It's a long climb. We planned to camp for three days. We carried tents, sleeping bags, and metal spikes for our boots. The track was steep and there was a lot of snow. We had to be careful. After seven hours of climbing, we reached the top. It was a clear day. You can see the sea and the island of Skye. However, the mist had come down. Getting back down to camp can be as much of a challenge as going up. You need to be able to read a map properly. I was glad we had decided to take it in turns to do that job. That first time, it was only when I was safe in the tent that I could say I really enjoyed the experience.

**
Anna's new school is a very exciting place. It's made of wood, just like our old school, but it's also one of the first schools in my country that is designed to be really environmentally friendly. The school took months to build, so we saw it all happening. There are five classrooms in the school, which are enormous. We share one room with people in the town when they want to have meetings. There's also a nursery, a dining room, and big changing rooms. The school roof has a tree on top of it. The electricity for lights and computers comes from a wind turbine on a hill behind the school. We went with our teacher to look at it yesterday, and it goes round really fast. We're so pleased with our new school.

The International Book Club offers a book club membership. You can join by sending your first order from the book list. As a member, you'll save money on books and get free gifts. You can also order DVDs and magazines. To apply, simply fill in the enclosed form and return it in the postage-paid envelope.

Last month, I was hanging high above the river. I looked down and saw why people love rock-climbing. My friend Matt and I arrived at the Activity Centre on Friday evening. We had everything we needed, and we were pleased to be out of the city and in the fresh air. On Saturday morning, I met the other members of our group. We had come from various places and none of us knew the area. We knew we were going to spend the weekend outdoors, but none of us was sure exactly how. Half of us spent the morning caving while the others went rock-climbing. We changed at lunchtime. Matt and I went to the caves first. Climbing out was harder than going in, but after a good deal of pushing, we were out at last - covered in mud but pleased and excited by what we'd done.

On Saturday afternoon, I left my handbag on the bus. It contained some money and credit cards. When I realised what I had done, it was too late. I was worried and didn't know what to do. I stood by the side of the road and cried. A young man asked me what was wrong and I explained what had happened. He gave me some money for my bus fare home. I got home safely. The manager of the bus company offered to drive over to return my handbag. I got my handbag back. I would like to say how wonderful everybody was who helped me on that day. Mrs. B. James, Newport.

**
Sharks are some of the most frightening creatures in the ocean. They can see very well and feel movement through special lines on the sides of their bodies. Sharks are dangerous for smaller sea creatures that become their food. Although sharks are similar to other fish in a number of ways, their bodies are different. Sharks need to swim all the time in order to breathe and stay alive, so they hardly sleep at all. If sharks are turned over on their backs, they can stop moving completely. This is a very useful technique for researchers who are often required to handle sharks. It allows them to find out more about these fascinating creatures.

Australia is a beautiful country. There are many things to see and do in Australia. You can fly to Perth, Alice Springs, or Cairns. You can also take a coach from Sydney to Melbourne. There are also many things to see and do in each city.
You can visit the beautiful beaches, eat delicious food, and relax in the parks. You can also go on a day trip to the Blue Mountains or the Penguin Parade.
We promise that by the end of the trip, you'll be wanting to return to Australia.

**
Hi, my name is Nathalie. Last year, I was one of the youngest foreign students to join the Kirov's ballet school in St Petersburg, Russia. I was nervous at my first ballet class because I didn't know anyone. Everyone was friendly and asked me questions. I tried to say something in Russian, but they began talking in English. Now, six months later, everyone is really nice to me and I understand my teachers. I feel at home here. I like walking around the city and going to the different shops. I also like watching my favourite films on my computer.

The Arctic is a popular destination in the summer, but in winter, it is cold and dark. In the winter of 1990, a French artist named Jannot Derit was invited to have the opening of an exhibition in a specially built igloo in the little town of Jukkasjarvi. The building, named Arctic Hall, attracted many visitors. One night, a group of foreign guests decided to sleep in the Arctic Hall. The next morning, the guests were very pleased with their experience and the idea of an ice hotel was born. Today, the ice hotel is world famous. Every winter, a team of snow builders, architects and artists come to Jukkasjarvi to make the hotel. As soon as winter begins, the first part of the hotel is completed and it opens to visitors. The rest of the hotel is completed in the following weeks. The ice hotel melts in the spring. Guests can wear warm clothes and socks inside the hotel, but they need to bring their own sweaters and scarves. If you are planning to come to the ice hotel, you can buy warm clothes and socks on the website. You can also order equipment and book your visit at the same time. The hotel is in the village of Jukkasjarvi, 200 km above the Arctic Circle. You can get there by bus from the airport or train station.

**
A new furniture shop called Homestyle was opened last Thursday. Many people went to the shop to buy furniture. There were lots of special offers, including a leather sofa and a bed. The shop was very busy and had to be closed soon after it opened. The people outside the shop became angry because they thought everything would be sold before they could enter. The other problem was that there was a long queue of cars trying to get to the car park. Many people decided to just leave their cars in the middle of the road and walk to the shop. This meant that the road was completely blocked. One customer, Jenny Smith, said: 'I queued for three hours and I didn't have time to buy what I wanted. But the staff were very calm and explained what was happening. So I'll come back when they reopen but I'm not willing to queue again.'

The Short Story Society is a group that helps writers in Britain. It has been around for a long time, since 1899. The Society produces two magazines, the Short Story Review and Short Story News. These magazines have stories written by famous writers and also give new writers the chance to get their work published. The Society also runs a big competition called the National Short Story Competition. Anyone aged 18 and over can enter the competition. To join the Society, you can click on the website and fill out a registration form.

**
Tanya Streeter is a world-record-holding free-diver. She has broken four world records in free-diving, which is a sport where people reach great depths on one breath of air. In 2003, Tanya made history by being the first person to dive 120 meters into the ocean while holding her breath. She has also done a lot of other things to help the environment.
Tanya says that her life today is like living her childhood dreams. She grew up on the Caribbean island of Grand Cayman, and she loved to swim and explore the rockpools. Now, Tanya is well-known in some countries, and she thinks people are prepared to listen to her when she is talking about environmental issues.
As for the future, Tanya says she plans to keep breaking her own world records. She is in her thirties, but she doesn't intend to retire from the sport for many years to come.

**
Cartoon films have few limits. If you can draw something, you can make it move on the cinema screen. New ideas and computer programs make cartoons exciting again for people of all ages. In the 1970s, people thought that cartoons were only for children. But soon afterwards, some directors had new ideas. They made films that both adults and children could enjoy. Not every cartoon film was successful. The Black Cauldron, for example, failed because it was too frightening for children and too childish for adults. Directors learned from this mistake, and the film companies began to make large amounts of money again.

New TV star Caroline Benson talks about her first TV role. She had always dreamed of becoming an actress. She took a year off to go travelling before university. While she was in Chile, she heard that there were plans to turn the book into a TV drama. She knew she had to go for the part. She got the part and started filming. After university, she definitely wants to make acting her career. She's not from an acting family, but she's tried for other TV parts and hasn't received any offers yet.

No Title When I opened the first 'Body Shop' in 1976, I wanted to earn enough to feed my children. Today 'The Body Shop' is a company that is growing all around the world. I have learned a lot since we began. Much of what I have learned will be found in this book. I believe that to succeed in business you have to be different. Business can be fun, a business can be run with love and it can do good. I have always wanted the people who work for 'The Body Shop' to feel the same way. Now this book sends my ideas out into the world, makes them public. I'd like to think there are no limits to our 'family', no limits to what can be done. I find that an exciting thought. I hope you do, too.

A boat trip along the Douro River in Portugal is operated by a company called Voyages Jules Verne. The MV Lady Ivy May can take 160 guests in double cabins. There is a lot of stuff to do on board the ship, including sun-bathing, lounging, drinking, and eating. The journey takes several days and stops at many interesting places, such as Peso da Regua, Lamego, and Tua. You can also visit the cathedral and museum in Lamego. The museum has a collection of paintings, tapestries, and sculptures. After that, you will return to the ship and sail on to Tua.

HONEY Honey is a sweet liquid made by bees. It is made of water and sugars. Bees may travel as far as seventy-five thousand kilometres and visit many flowers to produce honey. The colour and flavour of honey depend on the type of flower visited. There are more than three hundred varieties of honey. The lighter-coloured ones are generally milder in flavour than darker honey. In ancient times, honey was the main sweet food. It was of great value to the ancient Egyptians, who used it as payment. Today, honey is produced and eaten in every part of the world. Honey is good for you. It can prevent tiredness and improve athletic performance. However, honey is not just food - it can also be taken for sore throats and used in many skin and hair-care products.

Norwich is a city in East Anglia, England. It has existed for a long time. It was a small village at one time, but it grew to become one of the largest towns in England. Today, Norwich is smaller than London or Manchester, but it has a lot of interesting things to offer. There are two cathedrals and a mosque in Norwich. The city also has a university, a shopping centre, and a football team. Norwich is a popular place to live and visit.

The Albuquerque Balloon Festival is an annual event that takes place in Albuquerque, New Mexico, in the United States. It is held every autumn and celebrates the local radio station's anniversary. There are many hot-air balloons at the festival. They take off from the car park in the middle of Albuquerque. The festival has grown a lot since its first year. This year, there will be a thousand balloons from all over the world.
You can see the balloons glow at night. To see the 'glows', you must arrive just after night has fallen or before 5.30 am. You can also walk around among the balloons and chat to the pilots. There are plenty of other attractions at the festival, including balloon races and firework displays.
If you want to take part in the festival, you can buy your tickets in advance and wear several layers of thin clothing. You should also bring a flashlight and your camera.

The Eden Project is a popular tourist attraction in the south-west of England, UK. It has big buildings that look like science-fiction movies. Inside each building, there is a different climate zone. Visitors can see how plants and people are related. Many products that we use every day come from plants. There are a lot of different plants grown here. The weather is always cold outside, but the plants are kept warm by electric heaters. In the Rainforest Zone, there is a lot of water. There is also a zone that reproduces the environment of the Mediterranean.

The best age to start learning the violin is between three and six, says Margaret Porter, a violinist and music teacher. It's the time when you are learning about the world. Margaret, who lives in London, prefers to take pupils at three and four, although she has made lots of exceptions for keen five-year-olds. When she started teaching the violin in 1972, her first class consisted of her children's five-year-old school friends. Margaret's pupils have group lessons. Each group has about a dozen pupils and each lesson lasts an hour, once a fortnight. In addition, each pupil has one individual lesson a week with her. Parents also have to attend the classes. It is important that the parents take an active interest in the lessons. From the earliest lessons pupils learn to play by ear. They do not even try to read music until they have been playing for several years.

Moonshine The band Moonshine released their third CD last week. Their new CD is called 'Here again'. There have been a few changes since the last CD, with Tom Wilcott on bass guitar replacing Simon McVee who left the band last year. The band is no longer going to concentrate on slow songs. The first song on the CD is a dance tune. The second song is also a dance tune. Most later songs are in the bands more usual slow style. These two tracks will certainly come as a surprise to many fans. They could easily become hit singles. Singer Rob Letchford gets a chance to really show how good he is reaching each note perfectly. Fans should be grateful he recorded the songs for the album before he had trouble with his throat. This has rented in the band having to cancel their next tour.

**
San Francisco is a city in northern California, USA. It is a beautiful place with many famous landmarks. The earliest Europeans to discover the area were led by a Spanish explorer named Gaspar de Portola. He first saw it in 1769. Although San Francisco Bay is a wonderful natural harbour, it was discovered by land rather than by sea. In 1849, people arrived in San Francisco in their thousands hoping to find gold. However, it was not the men looking for the gold that got rich. The richest people made their money from owning banks and law firms and they built themselves large houses on one of the hills. This was known as Nob Hill. Nowadays, tourists are attracted to San Francisco because there they can see famous places like Chinatown and the Golden Gate Bridge. Many even take the short boat trip to the island of Alcatraz to see the former prison.

Samuel Pepys wrote a famous diary in English. It tells about his life in England between 1660 and 1669. Pepys writes about important events that happened at the time, like disease, a war, and the Great Fire of London. He also writes about himself and his family. He describes his home life, his friends, and his hobbies. Pepys was a busy man who had many important jobs. He was a Member of Parliament and President of the Royal Society. He is also remembered for his work for the British Navy.

In the past, people wore shoes that were not comfortable or fashionable. They were probably made of animal skin. We still use leather today, but other materials such as silk, plastic, or cotton are also popular. It was only one hundred and fifty years ago that people began to wear a different shoe on each foot. Formerly, the two shoes had been straight instead of shaped and could be worn on the left or the right foot. All shoes used to be made by hand, but now, most shoes are made by machines. The introduction of sewing machines allowed the shoe industry to produce large quantities of cheaper shoes for a wider range of buyers.

No Title
When I injured my back, I had to take a break from running. I decided to introduce more women to the sport, to show them how much fun it can be and to give them the confidence to get out and run. I started a running group for women in my area because I was annoyed by the lack of women in the sport and the lack of separate changing facilities. I put up posters and many women joined. All of them were attracted by the idea of losing weight but I don't think they had really thought about running before. They ran for only a minute - now they can run for thirty minutes. They've also learned from other runners about diet and keeping fit in general. I wanted to do something for women's running and I've had so much pleasure watching their progress - almost as much as they've had themselves.

In the 1880s, there was a lot of gold found in Alaska. Many people came to the area to get rich. New towns were built and grew quickly. One such town was called Iditarod. It grew so quickly that it became the largest city in Alaska for a while.
In the winter, the rivers and the ocean froze and there was no way to get to the towns. So, in 1910, a track was built which would be used by teams of dogs pulling sleds. They would take mail, food and clothes to the gold miners. The track became known as the Iditarod Trail.
Nowadays, there is a dog sled race held every year from Anchorage to Nome, following the route of that famous journey in 1925. It is called the Iditarod and has become known as 'The Last Great Race on Earth'.

**
The village of Jukkasjarvi is in Sweden. Winter temperatures there can reach very cold. But many people still go there to visit what is probably Europe's most unusual accommodation. In this hotel, you can eat, drink, and sleep in rooms made of ice. If you want, you can even get married in one. The bar is also made of ice. Putting hot drinks on it is not recommended. The bedrooms are very cold, but fortunately guests are provided with special sleeping bags that will keep them warm in the coldest of temperatures. You can also get outdoor clothes if you need them. The hotel is never more than six months old because it melts in summer, and each winter it is rebuilt.

Maria Mutola was playing football in a local competition in Mozambique in 1988. She won the competition. At first, no one thought it was a problem that she was a girl. But then, the team they beat complained. The story appeared in a local newspaper and Jose Craveirinha, who had encouraged other African athletes, learned about Maria. He went to meet her and found her kicking a ball around outside the football club. He realized that she was fast. He talked to Maria about athletics. Maria had no idea what he meant. The only sport she knew about was football. Then, Jose bought her running shoes and took her training. It was hard work and Maria's legs really ached. But Jose visited her parents and persuaded them she could be successful. They agreed to let him take her away to train. In 1991, Maria finally accepted an invitation to train in the United States. She had refused previously because she knew she would miss her family. Today, Maria still runs and for most of the year, she lives happily in South Africa with her mother.

The Grand Canyon in the United States was created by the River Colorado. People visit the Grand Canyon Park to go walking and running, but mainly to look at the view. It is a wonderful view made even better by the Skywalk. The distance from the Skywalk to the bottom of the Grand Canyon is 1219 meters. It is a platform whose walls and floor are made of glass so that you can see the beautiful rocks of the canyon. Up to 120 people are allowed to stand on it at the same time. It opened in 2007 and since then thousands of people have used it. You have to wear special covers over your shoes to avoid scratching the glass beneath your feet. Walking onto the Skywalk makes you feel like a bird floating high up in the air.

The Rocky Mountains run across North America. They start in the northwest and lie a few hundred miles from the centre in more southern areas. The Rockies are smaller than the Alps, but they are still wonderful. There are many roads across the Rockies, but the best way to see them is to travel by train. You start from Vancouver, a city in Canada. Vancouver is a beautiful city with a lot of mountains and water. There are passenger trains that run from Vancouver to other cities in North America. You can sleep on board the train and travel through some of the best scenery at night.

People began to keep animals in zoos a long time ago. In the past, animals were taught to perform for the visitors. Today, zoos are used for people to see animals behaving naturally. Most cities have a zoo or wildlife park. However, not everybody approves of zoos. Some people think that zoos are a good idea, while others disapprove. Those who think zoos are a good idea say that they provide us with the opportunity to learn about the natural world and be close to wild animals. Others argue that zoos are not a good idea because they believe it is wrong to put animals in cages.

I play the trumpet in my school jazz band. Last month, we held a jazz competition with bands from local high schools - and our band won! We had our own costumes, like black school uniforms or brightly-coloured T-shirts. We didn't look much like adult professional bands, but we were all used to performing in competitions. We also created new tunes right there on stage. It was exciting to watch - but even better when my band played on stage. We have a great jazz band at my school, but not everyone who wants to play in it gets accepted - only about half. But anyone who's keen to play goes to jazz practice before school, and we often spend time together after school, listening to jazz and learning its language.

Marrakesh, Morocco, is a city that receives a lot of rain between November and March. Sometimes, the rain falls heavily and the city's water pipes can't handle the sudden floods. But, as many winters have been dry in recent times, when the rain does come, it is welcomed by the local people. Marrakesh's parks and gardens exist thanks to a network of underground channels, dug in the 11th century, which bring in water from the mountains all year round. These channels are known as oases. Further south from Marrakesh, the traveller arrives at Skoura. Here, the land is made into small squares by the water channels and used to grow food. The Atlas mountains, snow-covered in winter, provide a delightful background.

Gareth Ellis, 13, is the youngest son of Alan and Kath. He has two older brothers who work in banking and computers. Gareth's dream was always to become a clown. Three years ago, Alan, Kath and Gareth joined the circus. They travel with the circus during the summer and return home for the winter. Gareth calls himself Bippo.

Eight-eighteen News is a news agency for young people. The members of our agency are aged 8-18. We collect news and write news reports, stories and articles. We send these to newspapers, magazines, television and radio stations. You can read or listen to the news stories and articles on the Eight-eighteen website. We have three centres around the country where young people can meet other members and get involved in projects. We intend to open new centres nationwide. Since our news agency started in 1994, over 2,500 young people have been members. If you are interested in joining, call Director Den Ley at 01622 657874 for more information.

Antarctica Sightseeing Flights website. You can book a flight to Antarctica from Sydney, Australia. The flight is about 12 hours long. You will see sea ice and icebergs about four hours into the flight. You can also see talks on the environment and history given by experts who have lived on scientific research stations. There are also photo opportunities. You can take photographs of the scenery and the plane.

**
For one group of children, Saturdays are special. They learn how to cook. Their lessons are popular. There is a waiting list of children who want to do the course. Parents pay a fee for the course. The children can have fun and learn how to make good food.
There is a young boy named Bill who loves his mum's cooking. He can do it better than his mum. The teachers make the children laugh. They share the food they've made.
There is also a young girl named Flora who loves cooking. She did a meal for ten friends. Her mum suggested she take up a hobby. Flora was happy staying at home. She wasn't too keen at first. But she's glad she decided to come.
Their teacher, Philippe, says, 'It's great fun.' The children pay attention and remember things better than adults. Although the kitchen isn't always as tidy when they're cooking, they have a lot of fun.

Winter driving is dangerous because it's difficult to know what is going to happen and accidents happen easily. Fog can be waiting for you over the top of a hill. Ice might be hidden beneath the melting snow, waiting to send you off the road. The car coming towards you may suddenly slide across the road. To drive safely on icy roads, you should drive smoothly and pay attention to what might happen. If you drive smoothly and gently, you can avoid trouble. You should also allow extra space for stopping when the road is wet, snow, or ice. Try to stay in control of your car at all times and you will avoid trouble.

Craigie Aitchison was born in Scotland. He came to London to study law, but he went to art school instead. There he found the drawing classes difficult, but he still kept on painting. In his late twenties, he was given money by the Italian government to study art, and he became interested in early Italian artists. He loved the greens and browns of the Italian fields and the clear light there. He wanted to put this light into his paintings. This led him to paint colours thinly one on top of another from light to dark. He says, 'It's a secret - because I don't know myself. I don't start by painting yellow, knowing I'm going to put anything on top.' Like most talented people, Aitchison makes it sound easy. 'Anyone can do the colours - you can buy them. I simply notice what you put the colours next to.' Unlike some artists, he never does drawings before he starts a painting. Instead, he changes his paintings many times before they are finished.

Two years ago, Ben, a 14-year-old, asked us for a set of drums for his birthday. We were not sure whether to give him the drums because of the noise. But Ben argued that it was better than watching television or playing computer games. In the end, we gave in. We said, 'All right,' but you must consider the rest of the family and the neighbours when you play.
Because drums are not easy to transport, the other members of Ben's band started appearing at our home with their guitars and other electrical equipment. For several hours a week, the house shakes to the noise of their instruments and their singing.
I am always stressing to Ben how important his studies are, but one thing is certain - Ben was right: it has kept him out of trouble and he is never bored.

**
Last week I went to visit Atlantic College, a private college in Wales. It gives young people the opportunity to study for their exams and learn about life outside the classroom. The students, who are aged between 16 and 18 and come from all over the world, spend their morning studying. In the afternoon they go out and do a really useful activity, such as helping on the farm, looking after people with learning difficulties, or checking for pollution in rivers. One of the great things about Atlantic College students is that they come from many different social backgrounds and countries. As few can afford the fees of PS20,000 over two years, grants are available. To sum up, Atlantic College gives its students an excellent education.

I am an older student. I finished my first year at university. I have to read books quickly and write long essays. I decided to go to university after many years away from school. I was bored doing my job as a secretary. I was unhappy because I felt stuck in my job. I was jealous of the students at the university. I am glad that I have the opportunity to study. I know that I need a qualification to get a rewarding job. I prefer a weekend with my books to one out partying. I also have the normal student benefits of long holidays and theatre and cinema discounts.

Henry Ford was born on a farm in Michigan in 1863. He did not like farming. When he was fifteen, he began working as a mechanic. In 1893, he built his first car. After he had driven it a long way, he sold it and built two bigger cars. Then, in 1903, he started the Ford Motor Company. He built cheap cars for ordinary people to buy. In 1908, he built the first Ford Model 'T'. It was a simple car that sold for $825. By 1927, the Ford Motor Company was worth a lot of money. Early Ford cars were simple and cheap, but keeping things simple sometimes meant less choice.

Rebecca Stevens was the first woman to climb Mount Everest. Before she went up the highest mountain in the world, she was a journalist and lived in a small flat in south London. In 1993, Rebecca left her job and her family and travelled to Asia with some other climbers. She found that life on Everest is hard. You must carry everything on your back, she explained, 'so you can only take things that you will need. You can't wash on the mountain, and in the end I didn't even take a toothbrush. I am usually a clean person but there is no water, only snow. Water is very heavy so you only take enough to drink!' When Rebecca reached the top of Mount Everest on May 17 1993, it was the best moment of her life. Now she has written a book about the trip and people often ask her to talk about it. She has a new job too, on a science programme on television. Rebecca is well known today and she has more money, but she still lives in the little flat in south London among her pictures and books about mountains.

Dear Mike, I'm sorry you couldn't come to my party yesterday. You had a bad cold and decided to stay in bed. Are you feeling better now? It was a good party. Lots of my friends were there and they gave me some presents. I will tell you more about the party when you come to school on Monday. Love, Lorenzo

Canada Geese are large blue and white birds. When the weather gets colder, they have to fly south where the weather is warmer. The winters are very cold in Canada. Last spring, Bill found some young Canada Geese on his farm. They had lost their parents. Bill thought, 'These young birds won't know what to do in the winter.' Bill had a small plane and he decided to teach the birds to follow him. All through the summer, he went on short trips in his plane and the young geese flew after him. When the cold weather arrived, Bill flew to the United States, 600 miles south of his home in Canada. The geese followed him all the way. Bill left the geese in the United States and he returned home. This spring, Bill was waiting for the birds to come back. They didn't arrive, so Bill flew to the United States to get them. He looked for them for two weeks but he couldn't find them. When he arrived back home, Bill found the geese waiting for him. They had found their way home without him.

**
When Esther left school, her aunt gave her a lot of money. She used the money to start her own business. She bought fruit, sugar and some jars and began making jam. She sold the jam to her friends and she soon made a lot of money. Her parents didn't want her to spend her time making jam and they thought that she should study instead. But Esther didn't listen to them. She just kept on making jam. After a few months, she started selling it to the local market. Then she started making orange juice. She sold this to a school where one of her friends worked. After two years, her business was very large and her parents were very pleased with her. She made all kinds of food which she sold to shops and supermarkets. She was so busy that she had to get some people to work for her.

Corryvale Farm is in the west of England. Stephen and Jenny Blackler have cows and chickens. They also have sheep. Jenny has a lot of sheep. Each one has enough wool for six sweaters. Every six months, Stephen cuts the wool off the sheep. Jenny made some sweaters and socks with the wool. Everybody loved the socks because they were cheap, strong and easy to wash. That's how Jenny's business started. At first, she made the socks at home, but soon she had a lot of customers so she had to send the wool to a factory. There are lots of different socks. Jenny is busiest at Christmas because Corryvale socks are a favourite present.

28 Long Road, Brighton. 22nd March. Dear Pat, I arrived here three weeks ago. I'm studying at a language school in Brighton. The students come from many different countries and I have made a lot of new friends. There are classes for five hours every day. I like our teacher very much. His name is John and he helps me if I make a mistake. I want to visit London next weekend because I am going back to my country on Monday. Can I see you there? Please write to me soon. With best wishes from Maria.

BURGLARS LOVE THE AFTERNOON Most house burglaries happen between 2 p.m. and 6 p.m., say the police. A lot of burglaries happen when people have gone out and forgotten to close a door or a window. Night-time burglaries are unusual because families are usually at home at that time. But winter afternoons are the best time for burglars because it is dark and they can't be seen easily. Also many houses are empty at that time, because people are often still at work. To keep burglars away, it is a good idea to leave lights on in living rooms and bedrooms when you go on holiday. You should also call the police if you see anything strange.

Dear Lynne and Tony,
I'm writing to say thank you for the two nights I stayed in your lovely home. It was good to see you again. Here are the photos of your children that you asked for. They're good photos, aren't they? I hope you like them. I really love my new camera. I'm going to visit my sister in New York next week. I'm going to take a lot of photos there, too. I haven't seen my sister for a long time. Thanks again. Love, Roy

**
The history of farming. Long ago, people used to go to the forest to find food. But about 12,000 years ago, people began to grow food in the Middle East. These people were the first farmers. Farming made it possible for people to stay in one place and build bigger villages. Some people in the villages became free to do other work, like making clothes, because the farmers could grow food for everyone. Unfortunately, farming was difficult when the weather was bad and sometimes people did not get enough food to eat. Today, farmers can grow more food and it travels thousands of kilometres from where it is grown to our homes.

**
Nicola Peet left school and went to college. After that, she worked at a local airport. One day, she went to work for a big airline. Four years later, she got her present job as a manager. This is what she told us about her job: 'My office is at the airport, but I spend most of my time flying. I teach air hostesses and help them with any problems. I also go to lots of meetings. My hours are usually from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. but sometimes I work from 1 p.m. to 9 p.m. At work, the first thing I do is check plane times on my computer and then I speak with some of the air hostesses. Sometimes I go on long flights to check how the air hostesses are doing. That's my favourite part of the job, but I like office work, too. Travelling can be hard work. When I get back from a long journey, all I can do is eat something and then go to bed!

**
Dear Maria,
It's good to be back home in my country. I still think about all the friends I made in our English class, especially you. I cried when I left England because my visit was too short. I would like to return to England but next time I will stay in a different city. I have started English classes again here. I learned a lot of things in England but I know I need to study even harder. How about you? Are you still looking for a job? I hope you find it soon. Love, Sophie.

If you have found my bag, I would be grateful if you could let me know. I would also like to know if I can come to the office to get it. The office opens at 9:00 a.m. and closes at 6:30 p.m. every day.

Mary Johnson

**
The Weather People are interested in the weather for a lot of reasons. It is important for people in many different jobs. For example, the weather makes a big difference for farmers. Many years ago, farmers spent a long time looking at the sky and at animals and flowers to try and learn more about the weather. Now there are lots of computer programmes which help us to learn about the weather, and people can even get weather information on their mobile phones. Today, a lot of people still believe in the old ideas about the weather. They say, for example, that if there is a red sky in the evening, it will be sunny the next day. Some people also think that when cows lie down in the fields, it will soon rain.

**
Frazer and Peter are two 14-year-old boys who live in a small town in Canada. They have been friends since they were young. They like to go fishing or swimming on the weekends. But for the last few months, they've spent every weekend working on their computer. They made a new game. The game is a speaking and picture game. If you look at the word 'hat', there's a drawing of a hat next to it and you can hear Peter saying 'Hat! Hat!' at the same time.

**
Sleeping well is very important. When I can get home to my mother's house, I sleep for ten hours. But I find it very difficult to sleep at night after a concert because my head is full of music. Sport is important. Before I had a car accident, I was at the sports centre two and a half hours a day, five days a week. I can't do that now so I do about 150 sit-ups a day. I don't drink alcohol or smoke. I try to eat well. Also I drink a lot of water because it's good for your health. I should have about eight glasses a day but I don't always drink so much. People shouldn't work all the time. I love my job but there are other things I like doing too. In my free time, I just listen to music or watch TV. It's good to do nothing sometimes. I don't get tired any more since the doctor told me to eat better. Now I eat lots of things like carrots and spinach every day. But I still eat burgers sometimes.

**
'Bollywood, which is the name of the film industry in Mumbai, India, makes a lot of films. It makes almost 1,000 films a year. Since making its first film in 1913, Bollywood has made over 29,000 films. This is a lot higher than the USA and means it is the biggest film industry in the world. Most Indians like watching films better than any other free-time activity and ten million of them go to the cinema every day. Bollywood films tell romantic love stories, and singing and dancing are an important part of every film. Indian films are also enjoyed outside India. Last year, Bollywood made over $500 million by selling its films to other countries. Indian actors make more films each year than American actors in Hollywood, but they are not paid as much. This is why most Bollywood films only cost about $2 million to make. Most Bollywood actors are young. They work hard but only for a few years. Amitabh Bachchan, who some people say is India's greatest actor, is different. He has been the star of more than 140 films during an acting career of almost 40 years.'

**
I was born in the United States, but I have written travel books about England. I lived in England with my wife and children for many years, but now we live in the United States. My children are learning about life in the United States. I'm sure they will be happier because they have lived in two countries. I like England and I want to return, but my daughter is going to start college there soon, so it won't be for another four years. I have just been to England to work on a radio programme about the English language and also to talk about the book I've just written. Most writers don't like doing this; they don't like travelling around the country, selling their book. I don't mind it. I like visiting new places and meeting lots of people. It's very different from the life I have in the United States when I'm writing. In England, people drove me around in big cars and I stayed in expensive hotels. It was good because I didn't have to pay any bills. Everyone was kind to me and it was fun.

There are three sizes of Schnauzer dog. The two smaller sizes first came to England a long time ago. The Giant Schnauzer has not been here very long. The name Giant is a good one because the dogs are tall. All the dogs have long hair, which should be cut quite often. Most smaller Schnauzers are grey in colour, but the Giant Schnauzer is usually black. Schnauzers come from Germany, where farmers use the dogs to help them with their sheep. They are also used by the police, because Schnauzer dogs are very intelligent. A Schnauzer makes a nice family dog. It is friendly and very good with young children.

The Ruwenzori Mountains are a range of mountains in Africa. Mary Daniels is a student in England. This year she had a very interesting summer holiday. She travelled with fifteen other people to the Ruwenzori Mountains in Africa. They went there to help make a road through a forest between two big towns. 'It was very difficult because there was no water to drink and no shops where we could buy food,' said Mary. 'It was also very cold and wet in the mountains. It is one of the wettest places in the world.' Mary stayed in the mountains for six weeks. It was hard work, but she says it was the best thing she has ever done. She is hoping to return next year to do some more work there.

Dear Keira,
Thank you for your letter. I had my first day at my new school today. A girl called Nicole helped me and showed me where the classrooms were. She is very nice and I am going to visit her this weekend. My favourite lesson today was Maths and I was happy because I knew more than the other girls. I also played hockey for the first time. I really enjoyed it. Most of the teachers are friendly but I'm afraid of the head teacher. No one likes him because he shouts a lot. I must go now because I have to do my homework. Hester.

New books this month. There are two exciting stories.
The Long Night is David Reilly's first book. David became a writer after teaching English for several years. Maha is a nurse in northern Australia. One day a baby was so ill that Maha had to drive all night to get her to the nearest big city. They had a lot of problems getting there.
Hard Work is Joanna Jones's twentieth book. It is about Sombat, who works with his father, a carpenter, in Thailand. They work long, hard hours making tables and chairs, but they do not have any money.
Marcie Jacome, who studies English in London, wrote this story earlier this year. Tina is a young Brazilian woman whose dream is to become a doctor. She goes to London to study English and medicine but one day she meets a man who asks her to go to the USA with him to become a film star.
What will Tina do?

**
The history of horse racing. It started in Central Asia a long time ago. It was a popular sport in ancient times. Modern horse racing began when Arab horses were brought to Europe. Races became shorter and had more horses running against each other. Today, horse racing is popular in the USA and other countries.

**
World traveller Nick Barlow loves his work. He's a British actor and he travels around the world making TV programmes. People welcome me everywhere I go. When I get home, I remember all the wonderful things that happened in each country. Nick has travelled to many places but there are a few trips that he would still like to make. I'd love to visit South America and go back to Australia one day, he says. On each trip, Nick travels with a team of people. They bring the cameras and other filming equipment needed to make the programme. Nick doesn't take a lot of things for himself, just a few shirts and trousers, but he always makes sure he has some books in his suitcase. Nick's wife, Helen, doesn't mind him travelling for his work. She has a lot of friends and keeps busy. When he gets back, she likes to listen to all his travel stories. But sometimes there are problems. When he was in the Malaysian rain forest, Nick heard that his wife was ill in hospital. 'I felt terrible because I couldn't help, but she didn't want me to come home. I was so happy when I heard she was better.''

Parrots are beautiful birds that live in the forest or in the zoo. They live in large groups and like to eat fruit. There are many different kinds of parrots, but they all have strong beaks and feet. The biggest birds can live for up to 80 years. They are very noisy, but they are clever birds and it is easy to teach them to talk. Some zoos have parrot shows, where you can see the birds doing things they have learned.

**
Howard Bonnier is a young Englishman who lives in a village called Bray, which is about fifty kilometres west of London. He has a restaurant called The Palace. Not many people in Britain know Mr Bonnier's name yet, but he's already quite famous in France. This is because he has written in French magazines about almost all the best restaurants in that country. He's only 29 years old. When Howard was a teenager, he often went to restaurants with his family. He liked doing this so much that he decided to open a restaurant. He loves cooking. Has it been an easy thing to do? He says it's expensive to start your own restaurant and it's much more difficult to cook for fifty people than to cook for your family, but he's sure he's done the right thing.

**
John Pickering is a gardener who lives in a small town in central England. He cuts the grass and waters the flowers. Last week, he was in Tokyo and many people watched him on television because he is very popular in Japan. John visited Japan a few months ago to sing in dance clubs. A disc jockey heard his songs and played them on his radio show. Hundreds of young people phoned the radio and asked the disc jockey to play the songs once more. John is not going to stop working in the park. He does not know yet how much he will earn from his music.

Hello everyone,
I'm planning the holidays for next year. Please tell me when you would like to take your holiday. If you could give me two dates, that would be great. Please give me your answer by the end of the month. Thank you.
Could I take two weeks' holiday in July? I'd like to take the first two weeks, but if that is not possible, the last two weeks will be OK. Also, can I take three extra days in the first week of December?

**
Line dancing is a popular hobby in Britain. Many people enjoy line dancing in their towns. It is easy to learn if you have two feet and can walk. You don't need a partner because you dance in groups. It's the best way to make new friends. In my classes, there are young and old people. The boys like it because they can make a lot of noise with their feet during the dances.

**
There are five different types of rhinos in the world today. The Black and White Rhino live in Africa. The others live in forests in Asia. Rhinos have big, heavy bodies. Their skin is very hard and they have very little hair. The rhino stands on four short legs. Each foot has three toes. Rhinos usually walk very slowly, but they can run at 50 kilometres an hour. Rhinos are usually quiet and calm animals, and they only eat grass and other plants. A baby rhino weighs 40 kilos when it is born. It has been inside its mother for about fifteen months. An adult rhino weighs over 200 kilos and may live to be 50 years old.

**
In London in the 18th century, there were no policemen. A few old men used to protect the city streets at night. About 300 years ago, London was starting to get bigger. The city was very dirty and many people were poor. There were so many thieves who stole money in the streets that people stayed in their homes as much as possible. In the 18th century, there was a group of people who helped to stop thieves. They were like policemen and were called 'Bow Street Runners' because they worked near Bow Street. Today, London police are quite well paid.

Would you like to come on a camping trip this weekend? We are going to go to the forest in the school bus and we will stay at a campsite from Friday to Sunday. It has hot showers and a small shop and you can rent bicycles there. The trip costs PS25. It is very cold there at night, so you should take warm clothes and wear strong shoes. If you want to come, tell me today. Ahmed, Student Secretary.

**
Every year, thousands of people come to Edinburgh, the capital city of Scotland, to be part of the Edinburgh Festival. The festival lasts for three weeks every August and September. During this time, the streets of the city are filled with music and dance. You can even see artists painting pictures on the streets. One of the best parts of the festival is the 'Fringe', where students do comedy shows. Tens of thousands of tourists come to the festival to see new films and plays and hear music played by famous musicians. This year, you can see over five hundred performances with actors from more than forty countries. The tickets for these performances are quite cheap. So come to Edinburgh next summer.

**
If you drive north from Toronto for three hours, you come to Lake Nipissing. In winter, the lake becomes ice, and thousands of Canadian fishermen travel there each weekend. They build little houses of wood on the ice and paint them in bright colours. Then they sit inside to catch the fish that swim under the ice. Bob Marvisch has come here at this time of year for twenty-five years.
You need clothes that are light but warm. Catching the fish is easy. First you break the ice and make a small hole in it. Next you take a fishing line and put some bread on it. Then you put the line through the hole and into the water. You pull the line up when the fish eat the bread. They are small. Some people like to eat them, but when I have caught three or four fish, I prefer to have some chocolate or other snack. Today I have caught twenty-five. It's a great sport and you can meet some nice people here.

From: Greg To: Anna Hi Anna, I'm not having a very good week. Yesterday, my team lost a volleyball match. The other team played much better than we did. My friend Jeff, who lives in Australia, called me with bad news. He can't come to stay with us during the holidays because he has a summer job. We can't go camping together now. This morning, my sister got up late and rode my bike to school. She didn't tell me she needed to use it. I'm really angry with her. I hope you have some good news. Write back today if you can. Greg

**
Madame Tussaud's museum is a popular place for tourists in London. People can see figures of famous people made of wax. Madame Tussaud was born in France in 1761. Her uncle, a doctor, made wax figures of people. He opened a museum of these figures in Paris. Marie helped him in his work. In 1789, during the French Revolution, Marie was sent to prison. Here she had to copy the heads of famous people when they were dead. In 1795, Marie married Francois Tussaud and in 1802 she came to London with her wax figures. Here she opened a museum and her figures can still be seen today.

**
Bicycles are a cheap and clean way to travel. The first bicycle was made a long time ago. At first, bicycles were expensive. Only rich people could afford to buy one. These early bicycles looked very different from the ones we have today. Later, when bicycles became cheaper, many people bought one. People started riding bicycles to work and in their free time. Today, people use cars more than bicycles. But some people still prefer to cycle to work. They say that there are too many cars in town centres and you can't find anywhere to park.

**
Last summer, I went to Thailand with my family. We went to a park and saw some elephants. The elephants were painting pictures. They drew pictures of a river, a tree and flowers. When the keepers held up the paintings, everyone wanted to buy one. We gave the elephants the bananas we brought for our lunch. Elephants used to work in the forest, but now they don't. The cleverest of these animals live in special centres where visitors can watch them.

** 'There are many different kinds of cats. They are different in size and they do not look or act the same. Tigers are the biggest cats. They can be very long. Most cats don't like water, but tigers will often lie in a pool of water when it is hot. Lions are the only cats that stay together in large family groups. They live in the open countryside where they can see a long way and easily follow other animals. All cats need good eyes and they also need to be fast and strong. '

There will be a lot of work in the kitchen. I'm sorry I have to leave the English class. You are a very good teacher. Please say goodbye to the other students for me. Thanks again. Dear Lorna,
How are you? I'm happy because I got a new job in the city centre. I work in a Tourist Information Office and it is very interesting. I start work every morning at half past seven, so I have to get up very early. I love this job because I meet people from many different countries. I like telling people about our city. Here is a photo of me. I'm wearing my new uniform. Do you like it? Love, Gloria

**
The ostrich is the biggest bird in the world. It can be more than 90 kilos. Most wild ostriches live in Africa. There are not many of them left. Ostriches have wings, but they cannot fly. They use their wings to help them turn when they are running. Ostriches can run very fast, from 65 to 90 kilometres an hour. Baby ostriches are the same size as chickens and take about 3 years to become adults. Ostriches eat plants and can live for many days without water.

**
Victoria, a student from Britain, started snowboarding a few years ago. She is now 23 and has won many competitions in this sport. We spoke to her when she was at a snowboarding competition last week in Switzerland. We asked her why she started snowboarding. "I like all kinds of sports, especially skiing, and it seemed natural to start snowboarding. It doesn't take long to learn and you can become really good in a few months."
We asked her if she had to do a lot of practice. "In winter, I snowboard in the mountains every day from 8.30 a.m. until 4 p.m. I also run and go biking. But I just love doing it all! I like the competitions and being in the mountains. It's so beautiful. But free-riding, that's doing what you want when you're not in a competition, is the best thing in the world for me."
We asked her what is important when you're learning. "You can learn quickly but you need lessons. It's also important to have the right clothes so you don't get wet because, to begin with, you spend a lot of time falling down!"

Dear Sir or Madam,
I would like to book a room at your hotel for three nights, from September 15th to 17th. I would like a single room with a shower and a telephone in the room. Can I have a quiet room on the ground floor? I am going to drive to the hotel. Is there a parking lot for guests? I will arrive at about 10.30 p.m. What time does the restaurant close in the evening? If possible, I would like to have a meal when I arrive. Thank you for your help.
Yours faithfully,
Mark Jones

Mount Kilimanjaro is the highest mountain in Africa. Many people have climbed Kilimanjaro, from a young boy to an old man. There are a few ways to climb Kilimanjaro. People think that the Marangu path is the easiest. It takes about five days and is popular with tourists. Not many people who try to climb Kilimanjaro get to the top. This is because the weather can change so quickly. Sometimes it can be hot and wet, but when climbers reach the top, they find ice and snow and the temperature may be below 20 degrees. Climbers need to pack sunglasses and warm clothes.

**
Otters are animals that live near rivers. They make their homes from small pieces of wood. They usually come out of their homes at night. Otters are very good swimmers. They can swim at more than 10 kilometres an hour. They have thick brown hair that keeps them warm in the water. An otter can close its ears and nose. This means otters can stay under water for several minutes. Twenty years ago, there were few otters in Great Britain. The water in the rivers was dirty and there was not much food for the otters. But today there is lots of food for them because the rivers are clean again.

I would love to go there one day. Do you live in a small village or in a big town? What is your school like? Have you got any pictures of your school you could send me? Dear David, I am going to visit your country next month. I'm going to travel with two friends. We don't know where to stay. Can you help us?
I have spoken to my aunt Gloria about you and she says you can all stay at her house. It has more bedrooms than my house. That will be alright with you, won't it? David.

People have always made buildings. We need houses to keep us warm and dry. We build stadiums so we can watch football matches and pop concerts. We use other buildings, like museums, to keep beautiful things in. Many people work together on a building. The architect decides how the building is going to look and draws pictures that show people his or her ideas. Engineers make sure the building will be strong and safe. Then, the workers carefully build it. The Sydney Opera House is a famous modern building with a lovely roof. But the building is beautiful from every side, not only from the top. There is also a famous roof on the Olympic Stadium in Munich. This interesting building looks like a tent that is made of glass.

Indre, I have a problem. I need your help to buy some new clothes. My grandmother is going to turn 80 next month and she is having a party on Saturday. I have grown so much that all my trousers are too short for me now. I want to buy some new ones and maybe a pair of boots. I haven't got a lot of money but I think it will be enough. Would you like to come shopping with me tomorrow? Let me know. Sarika.

**
The Cerne Giant Sherborne and Dorchester are two towns in the south of England that are close to each other. There are a lot of green hills and fields on the road between them. There is a picture of a very large man on one of these hills. The man in the picture is called the Cerne Giant because the village that is next to him is called Cerne. Nobody really knows when the Cerne Giant was made, but people think that it was a long time ago. To get nearer the picture, you can walk from Cerne. If you go on the first of May when the sun comes up, you will see all the people from the village dancing around the man on the hill.

**
Gail Rollins is one of Edinburgh's best runners. This summer she wants to run the 10,000 metres - and possibly the 5,000 metres - at the European Championships. In the past, Gail was well known for coming second in big competitions. But she always laughed and smiled, and people in her home city love her for this. But all that changed in 2004 when she ran in her first ever half-marathon, a very long road race. She won in a very good time, the fastest of the year by any British woman runner. Gail's manager and husband, Mike Rollins, also raced when he was younger, but he had to stop running in competitions when he hurt his right leg. He can still run a little and sometimes practises with Gail. But it's no fun for Mike when Gail goes past him and he can't catch up. Gail practises hard. She does a long run in the morning, followed by fast runs in the afternoon. But she always has a rest from running on Sundays.

**
Ivan Petrov was born on a farm in Russia. He studied music in Poland from the age of twelve to eighteen. His first music teacher couldn't play the piano but taught him songs from the opera. His mother began to teach him the piano when he was six. He started writing music when he was ten and soon wrote his first song.
Oleg Gagarin was born in Russia. His father taught him traditional Russian music when he was four years old. He started having lessons with a piano teacher when he was six and soon began to win prizes for his piano playing. He went to a music college in Austria when he was fourteen. Later, he returned home to Russia.
Josef Heptmann was born in Poland. His family moved to Germany when he was two. He started playing the piano when he was a year old. He gave his first concert when he was six and fifty-two concerts in two months during a trip to England when he was ten. He always liked music but he was also interested in physics and languages. He is too busy now but one day he would like to write his own music.

**
Bill Prince-Smith was a farmer and a teacher and a dentist before he became a writer of children's books. Now, he has written more than 80 books. Every day, he goes into his office and writes. In the evening, he gives the work to his wife to read. She tells me when she doesn't like something. Bill writes about the life in his village and on the farms near it. His fifth book is his favourite. The Sheepdog is about a farmer and the dog that helps him. Last year, the book was made into a film with real animals and actors. The film-makers used the latest computer technology to make people think that the animals are speaking. Bill was very pleased with the film.

**
Today, people like to send postcards to their friends and family. Postcards often have pictures of beaches, mountains or castles on them. You can write a message on the back of a postcard. Many people send postcards when they are on holiday because postcards are cheap and the pictures on them are often better than people's own photos. Somebody sent the first postcard at the end of the nineteenth century. It had a picture of a town by the sea on it. Later on, postcards had pictures showing something in the news that week, perhaps an accident or an important person's visit. People liked to see them because they did not have pictures in their newspapers then.

**
Dinosaurs were very long ago. No one has ever seen a dinosaur. The last dinosaur died a long time ago, before there were any people on the earth. Nobody knows for sure why they all died. The nearest living relatives of dinosaurs are birds. Dinosaurs didn't all look the same. There were more than 5000 kinds. Some were very small, but others were giants. The largest were bigger than any other animals that ever lived on land. The Brontosaurus, for example, was very long. It ate plants. The Tyrannosaurus Rex was not as big, but it was stronger. It had sharp teeth for eating meat. Also it could run fast because it had long back legs.

**
The bear is a strong animal. It can be dangerous. The adult bear is very strong and it can kill a person. Bears are good at climbing trees and they can run very fast. But they cannot see well and, like most animals, they find food by using their noses. There are two kinds of bear: The largest is the white polar bear, which is almost three metres tall. There is one kind of black bear that lives in the forests of North America. Not all black bears are black. They may be dark brown or a reddish brown. Everyone loves the black and white panda bear, which comes from China. Not many pandas live in the forest today because it is difficult to find food.

**
Crocodiles live in tropical parts of the world, such as Africa, South America and Northern Australia. They spend most of their time in slow-moving water, but they can move fast through the water and on land. You often see crocodiles together in large groups. They eat everything they catch, like fish, birds and small animals. And sometimes they make a meal of large animals or even people. There are more than ten types of crocodile. They all have very sharp teeth. Crocodiles are usually about 3.5 meters long, but some are much bigger. Crocodiles live for a long time. The oldest one kept in a zoo was 66 years old.

**
In 1783, two French brothers built the first balloon. A hundred and twenty years later, in 1903, the Wright brothers built the first plane with an engine and flew in it. This was in the United States. Then, in 1918, the US Post Office began the first airmail service. Aeroplanes changed a lot in the next thirty years. Then, in the 1950s, aeroplanes became much faster because they had jet engines. Today, millions of people travel by aeroplane. It is difficult to think of a world without them.

The Globe Theatre was a long time ago in London. It was different from a modern theatre. The building was round, there was no roof, and people got cold and wet if the weather was bad. The queen liked to go to the Globe Theatre to see the plays of William Shakespeare. All the actors at that time were men. You can still visit the Globe Theatre today. There is a new theatre there. You can enjoy a Shakespeare play or just learn about life in the seventeenth century.
